page.title: 20ON STAGE AT GLYNDEBOURNE
page.content: Last year I played Puck in A Midsummer Night's Dream. I remember being called over the loud speaker and I walked to the part of the stage where I was to come on. When the cue came I burst on. I was a bit nervous at first but forgot to be after a while. When I had been on stage for some time I was very hot. In some scenes I took off in an airbourne log. I clipped onto the log by a metal clip and a harness around my back. When I finished I went to the wig room and had my wig taken off. Then the make-up people removed my make-up. The words did not take very long to learn and neither were the moves difficult but it took a lot of nerves to fly on a magic log. It hurt my legs to stand on the log for 5 minutes. On the first night I got 20 cards and 4 boxes of chocolates. That's my favourite part of the opera.
